channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: HSBC Names Georges Elhedery as Chief Executive
item.description: Georges Elhedery, who has spent two decades at the bank, will take over as chief executive after it unexpectedly said earlier this year that Noel Quin...

item.title: Why a ‘do-nothing’ Congress is a winning vote for your stock portfolio
item.description: The U.S. stock market on average has done better when Congress is not in session.

item.title: Wall Street Wants In on America's Battery Storage Boom
item.description: A surge in solar power lets battery companies charge up during the day when power prices are low and sell in the evening at higher prices.

item.title: Global stock investor Jim Rogers: ‘I’m waiting for something to go wrong.’
item.description: ‘Probably by the end of this year or next year, the bear market will have resumed in the U.S.,’ Quantum Fund co-founder says.

item.title: Real-Estate Meltdown Strains Even the Safest Office Bonds
item.description: Defaults in a corner of the commercial real-estate debt market are surging and triggering losses.

item.title: Temperature-controlled warehouse REIT Lineage sets terms for the biggest IPO of 2024
item.description: Company to raise up to $3.85 billion at a valuation of up to $19.2 billion

item.title: Dow Clinches Best Day in More Than a Year, S&P 500 Hits New Record
item.description: The Dow industrials and S&P notched new highs Tuesday, while small-cap stocks extended their outperformance over megacap technology shares.

item.title: Leading Fed official says he still wants more data before supporting rate cut
item.description: A leading Federal Reserve official says he still needs a little more convincing before endorsing an interest-rate cut, a comment that all but rules ou...

item.title: Three Major Takeaways From Big Banks' Earnings
item.description: Wall Street businesses boomed while some consumers felt the pinch of higher rates.

item.title: My adviser told me to take Social Security early — and save $2.5 million for our kids. But shouldn’t I delay as long as I can?
item.description: “Our kids and grandkids won’t get our Social Security if we pass away at a younger age.”
